static member LowerVectorSizeWithRandomFourierTransformation : Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single> * int * bool * Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IComponentFactory<single, Microsoft.ML.Transforms.IFourierDistributionSampler> * Nullable<int> -> Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single>

Docs.param: The column to apply Random Fourier transfomration.
Create two features for every random Fourier frequency? (one for cos and one for sin)
Which kernel to use. ( by default)
The seed of the random number generator for generating the new features. If not specified global random would be used.
Docs.summary: It maps input to a random low-dimensional feature space. It is useful when data has non-linear features, since the transform is designed so that the inner products of the transformed data are approximately equal to those in the feature space of a user speciﬁed shift-invariant kernel. With this transform, we are able to use linear methods (which are scalable) to approximate more complex kernel SVM models.
